channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Woman wearing safety goggles AND glasses delivers flowers to No10 TWICE in one day
item.description: A diplomatic official from theÂ High Commission for Pakistan delivered huge bouquets to 'Hon Mr Prime Mininster & Ms Symonds, 10 Downing Street' twice today - wearing double the PPE on her second visit.

item.title: Number 10 reveals Britain's R0 is below 1
item.description: The UK Government this afternoon confirmed that COVID-19 is now spreading slower than a one-to-one infection rate, meaning the virus should burn itself out.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Boris Johnson says we're 'past virus peak'
item.description: Having chaired Cabinet this morning, Boris Johnson said he 'understands the impatience' of people to end the draconian restrictions crippling the economy.

item.title: Russian PM Mikhail Mishustin is diagnosed with coronavirus
item.description: Mikhail Mishustin, Russia's Prime Minister, pictured taking part in a video conference meeting in Moscow on April 28, has today said he has tested positive for the coronavirus.

item.title: Hairstylist reveals gross build-up caused by silicones and parabens
item.description: Sydney Augusta, from Seattle, Washington, shared the video on TikTok, and in it she is seen using hairdresser scissors to scrape a layer of build-up from a section of her hair.

item.title: President Trump says Sweden is 'paying heavily' for not bringing in a lockdown
item.description: Schools, restaurants and hair salons across Sweden have remained open amid the Covid-19 pandemic, which has infected upwards of 3.2million people globally.

item.title: London's transport network needs 'FOUR WEEKS' to prepare for lockdown ending
item.description: London's transport network could be crippled when the UK eases lockdown measures, a stark report revealed. RMT say the leaked report is a 'wake up call' for anyone pushing to lift lockdown.

item.title: Protected Spanish dunes blighted by tourists and nudists return to 'pristine' condition
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: The undulating Maspalomas sand dunes in Gran Canaria (pictured) have undergone a miraculous transformation which has left environmentalists stunned but delighted.

item.title: Germany gives the green light for museums, churches and zoos to reopen
item.description: Italian PM Giuseppe Conte bemoaned the 'rashness' of local politicians who opened up bars and pizzerias at a 'delicate stage' of the coronavirus crisis, four days before the lockdown is due to end.

item.title: Top COVID-19 model predicts 100,000 dead by end of summer
item.description: The MOBS model from the Network Science Institute at Northeastern University also estimates that there will be about 89,000 deaths by mid-May if stay-at-home orders remain in place.

item.title: US coronavirus deaths pass Trump's 'best case' scenario of 60,000 and start rising faster
item.description: The reported US death toll on Wednesday crept past 60,000, a figure that President Trump in recent weeks suggested might be the total death count. He had cited the estimate as a sign of success.

item.title: Tesla is sued by family of man, 44, who was run over and killed by car using Autopilot'
item.description: The family of Yoshihiro Umeda, 44, has sued Tesla after a he was killed by a car using Autopilot in Kanagawa,Japan

item.title: Ralph Rucci says door is now 'wide open' to criticize Anna Wintour after AndrÃ© Leon Talley's attack
item.description: Rucci took to Instagram Sunday to praise Talley for speaking out against Wintour in his new memoir, before unleashing his own tirade against the iconic Vogue editor.

item.title: Sadiq Khan's 'new normal': London Mayor offers bleak glimpse into city's future
item.description: Sadiq Khan has warned that London faces a bleak 'new normal' with large gathering banned, bars and restaurants closed and staggered school and work start times to avoid overcrowding.

item.title: Royal Navy patrol vessel shadows Russian warship RFS Boiky as it sails through the English Channel
item.description: Portsmouth-based HMS Mersey 'watched every movement' as RFS Boiky linked with an auxiliary vessel to refuel and transfer stores as it sailed through the international waterways of the Channel.

item.title: Police have handed out 8,997 fines for lockdown breaches in last month
item.description: One so-called 'covidiot'Â has been given six fixed penalty notices in the past month after refusing to comply with the rules to stop the spread of the virus that has claimedÂ 26,097 lives.

item.title: B&Q reopens all its 288 branches in UK today
item.description: The DIY store, which shut its doors on March 25, said its 288 outlets were now open to the public in an effort to 'enable the repair and maintenance of houses and gardens across the UK'.

item.title: Boris Johnson reveals his joy at being with fiancee Carrie Symonds for the birth of their son
item.description: The Prime Minister, 55, spoke during his first public appearance since fiancee Carrie Symonds, 32, had a baby boy at a London NHS hospital yesterday morning.

item.title: Coronavirus UK; Ministers draw up 10 'granular' blueprints for post-lockdown return to work
item.description: Ministers are working on a series of workplace guides going into 'granular detail' about the measures that will have to continue even when the lockdown is eased, which now looks like it will not be until June.

item.title: Eurozone economy suffers its worst drop on record
item.description: GDP in the 19-member eurozone fell by 3.8 per cent in the first three months of this year, even though lockdowns only began in March.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: A FIFTH of retailers have shut permanently
item.description: Adam Marshall, director general of the British Chambers of Commerce, made the astonishing revelation as pressure increased on Boris Johnson to plot a way out of the crisis.

item.title: Father who started photographing toys as a hobby now makes a full-time living with industry giants
item.description: Mitchel Wu, 57, from LA, tells amazing stories in just single photographs, with the help of a whole host of familiar toys - from popular Disney and Lord of the Rings characters, to Hasbro's Power Rangers.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Death toll 26,711; 674 new fatalities
item.description: NHS England declared 391 COVID-19 victims, while more were announced outside of hospitals and in Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland.

item.title: Boris Johnson says Britons SHOULD wear face masks after lockdown
item.description: Boris Johnson today announced that wearing face masks will be part of the UK's coronavirus lockdown exit strategy.

item.title: Boris Johnson announces huge spike in daily coronavirus tests to 81,000
item.description: Boris Johnson tonight announced a huge spike in the number of daily coronavirus tests to 81,000 as Matt Hancock appeared to be closing in on his 100,000 a day target.

item.title: People reveal the VERY literal ways of following instructions
item.description: Bored Panda users from around the world have compiled a list of the very literal instructions they have been given from friends and family including waiting at traffic lights meant for cars.

item.title: Zoom wedding makes it into the Times announcement column for the first time
item.description: Britain's upper classes are adjusting their etiquette rules during the coronavirus lockdown, with society bible Tatler revealing a guide on hosting a virtual get-together.

item.title: Coronavirus: US spy agencies conclude virus NOT 'man-made'
item.description: A statement on behalf of all the U.S. spy agencies acting in concert says they agree with the 'wide scientific consensus' that Covid-19 is not man-made but could have come from the Wuhan lab (pictured.)

item.title: Colonel Tom Moore revealed he appeared on Blankety Blank aged 63
item.description: Colonel Tom Moore's incredible National Health Service fundraising attempt isn't his first brush with fame, as it's revealed he previously appeared on Blankety Blank.

item.title: Robot gorilla 'spy' captures the first footage of Silverbacks in Uganda singing for their supper
item.description: Filmmakers created a life-like robot baby gorilla to spy on a group of Silverbacks in the jungle of Uganda. It captured the first footage of the wild creatures singing for their supper.

item.title: Parents issue warning over fears children have mystery 'inflammatory syndrome' linked to coronavirus
item.description: Becky White from Bately, west Yorkshire, feared for Freddie after six weeks of the illness, reported Metro. Suzanne Mawdsley's children (left) in Greater Manchester had different symptoms, reported MEN.

item.title: Rarely seen footage shows joyous scenes across Britain on the day Hitler
item.description: The programme VE Day In Colour: Britain's Biggest Party, which will be screened at 8pm on Sunday, shows rare footage of people celebrating VE Day around the world.
item.media:credit: Channel 4/VE Day in Colour: Britain's Biggest Party

item.title: Top Google AI expert attended Sage meeting of Government scientific advisers about coronavirus
item.description: Demis Hassabis, the founder and chief executive of the tech giant's DeepMind operation, sat in on a meeting of Scientific Advisory Group for Emergencies (Sage).

item.title: Coronavirus UK: British Airways warns it could abandon Gatwick
item.description: British Airways has today told staff in a memo that it may cease to operate flights out of Gatwick airport in Crawley after the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: SAS hero reveals terrorist nearly let off grenade disguised as a hostage in Iranian embassy siege
item.description: Warrant Officer Ian White was one of the 32 commandos who famously stormed the building in London to bring an end to the six day hostage siege in 1980.

item.title: Shocking moment Yodel driver lets himself into home of self-isolating family
item.description: The family, who live in Leeds, Yorkshire, is self isolating for 12 weeks because the six year old girl has asthma and is classified as high risk.

item.title: D-Day war hero, 99, who stormed Normandy in 1944 calls on the public to clap for veterans on VE Day
item.description: 99-year-old D-Day veteran Stanley Northeast is calling on the public to clap for war veterans at 7.45pm on VE Day. Stanley served across Europe with the RAF 6074 Squadron.

item.title: What Walt Disney World might look like when it reopensÂ post-coronavirus lockdown
item.description: Guidelines have been drawn up by the Orange County Economic Recovery Task Force, which has been charged with plotting the Florida area's route to normality.

item.title: Pilot study launching to examine if dogs can sniff out coronavirus
item.description: A new study from Penn Vet will have eight dogs be exposed to COVID-19 positive saliva and urine samples and then test if they can discriminate between positive and negative samples.

item.title: Travel agencies face legal action after blocking up to Â£7billion of refunds for cancelled holidays
item.description: The Competition and Markets Authority said it will take companies to court. Jo Lemmon Sparkes, 39, and wife Kirsty, 33, from Cambridge, are fighting Ryanair for a Â£700 trip.

item.title: Coronavirus causes hundreds of deadly blood clots in the lungs
item.description: Doctors looked at 83 severe COVID-19 patients at St James's Hospital in Dublin. They found tiny blood clots in the lungs which can lead to low oxygen levels.

item.title: Love Island 2020 could be AXED as ITV bosses say they don't want to send the 'wrong signal'
item.description: ITV boss Kevin Lygo said they may abandon plans for a summer series as it would feel inappropriate to have its stars 'slavering all over each other' while the country adheres to social distancing measures.

item.title: Duchess of Cornwall wishes 'that wonderful man' Colonel Tom Moore a 'very happy' 100th birthday
item.description: Prince Charles, 71, and Camilla, 72, have wished Captain Tom Moore a 'very happy 100th birthday' on the Clarence House Instagram page.

item.title: Victoria Beckham REVERSES her decision to furlough 30 staff
item.description: Victoria Beckham, pictured, has reversed a decision to seek a taxpayer bailout for her fashion firm by furloughing 30 staff which would have cost the taxpayer Â£150,000.

item.title: Kingdom Church still selling fake coronavirus cure while under investigation
item.description: London's Kingdom Church sell a bottle of oil and some red yarn for Â£91 and claim it will cure and protect the church's followers from coronavirus if inhaled with a towel or a bowl of hot water.

item.title: King Carl XVI Gustaf of Sweden shares sweet portraits with his wife Queen Silvia
item.description: Photographs, shared to the Swedish royal family's Instagram account, capture King Carl and his wife, Queen Silvia, at one of their summer residences, Stenhammar Palace in SÃ¶dermanland.

item.title: Man, 41, is arrested over murder of widower, 88, who was beaten to death in his Surrey homeÂ
item.description: A 41-year-old man has been arrested in connection with the murder of widower Dennis Kellond, 88, whose body was found at a home in the quiet Surrey village of Godstone this week.

item.title: Joggers and cyclists will have to stay 33 feet apart after lockdown restrictions are lifted
item.description: The measures announced on Thursday are designed to prevent a surge of new coronavirus cases in France.

item.title: See the flowers at the Keukenhof garden in Holland virtually, thanks to photographer Albert Dros
item.description: Dutch photographer Albert Dros was given exclusive access to the Keukenhof garden in the Netherlands, also known as the Garden of Europe. And the garden itself has created an amazing interactive tour.

item.title: Using cork to stopper a bottle of wine is BETTER for the environment than screw caps
item.description: Cork is produced from trees and these are never felled. Over the course of the product's entire lifecycle, it is carbon negative overall. It can capture up to 562g of CO2 in its lifetime.

item.title: Listed former Victorian courthouse and police station with its own cells goes on sale for Â£795,000
item.description: The Old Court in Clifton, Bristol, now has eight principal bedrooms and has been used as a guesthouse. It has not been used as a divisional magistrates court and police station for 60 years.

item.title: Vatican closes investigation into 15-year-old girl's 1983 disappearance
item.description: A search for Emanuela Orlandi's remains in a Holy See cemetery failed to resolve the mystery.
item.media:description: People, pictured in 2012, hold a pictures of missing girl Emanuela Orlandi reading, "march for truth and justice for Emanuela" in St. PeterÂ´s square, at the Vatican (Andrew Medichini/AP)

item.title: Brazil's President Bolsonaro says he is ignoring WHO on Covid-19 because it promotes 'masturbation'
item.description: Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro declared on social media he refuses to follow directives on social distancing from the WHO, because it promotesÂ 'masturbation' in children under four.

item.title: Zip-wire company goes bust after TV writer wins battle to stop thrill-seekers 'whizzing' past window
item.description: City Zip Company wanted to launch Â£30-a-ticket thrill seekers from the 150ft-high roof of St David's Hotel and Spa in Cardiff - and land on the other side of Cardiff Bay. Russell T Davies opposed plans.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Calls for Land Army of fruit and veg pickers will be ramped up
item.description: Farmers across Britain are concerned how they are going to reap their crops when that the of foreign workers usually seen at this time of year has been cut off due to the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Warship HMS Queen Elizabeth sets sail despite two sailors testing positive for coronavirus
item.description: The 65,000-tonne ship had been expected to take to the water from Portsmouth Naval Base at the start of the week, but the departure was delayed to allow the ship's company to be tested.

item.title: Furious woman slams her neighbour to the ground after she mocked her unmarried daughter
item.description: CCTV footage shows the mother and daughter from China, known by their surname Dai, getting into a gruesome street fight with their neighbour who had a row with the family over a game.

item.title: Remdesivir trial data 'offers hope,' says Gilead CEO
item.description: Gilead Sciences CEO Daniel O'Day wrote in an open letter obtained by Fox News that early results on his company's drug remdesivir's benefits for coronavirus patients offer 'hope' that's badly needed.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: The state-of-the-art protective face mask Premier League clubs are in talks to use
item.description: EXCLUSIVE BY SAMI MOKBEL: As part of the Premier League's new guidelines ahead of their planned return to group training next month, players will be required to wear face masks.

item.title: Gangs are using pizza delivery drivers to courier drugs to people stuck at home during lockdown
item.description: Drug dealers are using takeaway delivery drivers to drop 'pizza boxes or other food containers' containing cocaine, marijuana, ketamine and ecstasy at buyer's houses, warns Interpol.

item.title: FTSE 100 falls amid poor economic data from Europe
item.description: The FTSE 100 closed down 214 points or 3.5 per cent at 5,901 in London today, with sentiment damaged by reports that Boris Johnson is set to signal that the lockdown will stay until June.

item.title: Spanish hotels beg officials not to block Brits after coronavirus lockdown ends
item.description: Hoteliers from Benidorm, the Canary Islands, the Costa del Sol and the Balearics say relying on the local and Spanish market to revitalise the hard-hit industry just won't add up.

item.title: Matt Hancock faces MISSING 100,000-a-day testing target TODAY
item.description: Mr Hancock announced on April 2 he would achieve six-figure daily testing by close of play today but the latest numbers show 52,429 tests were carried out in the 24 hours to 9am yesterday.

item.title: Engineer, 54, spends 18 years and Â£15,000 building a RAILWAY to his hillside house
item.description: Allan Pyne, 54, lives with his wife RachelÂ in Dawlish, Devon, and has worked on the railways for more than 30 years. He has devised a track to ensure they do not have the difficulties of having to tackle steps.

item.title: Duncan Bannatyne escapes extended UK lockdown to jet back to his luxurious Â£3m Portuguese villa
item.description: The 71-year-old multi-millionaire flew on a private jet to his Â£3 million villa on the Algarve where he said he would spend 14 days in quarantine although restrictions will actually be lifted in three.

item.title: Two thirds of Britons think the Government acted TOO LATE in bringing in coronavirus lockdown
item.description: Two thirds now feel that the lockdown introduced on March 23 should have been imposed sooner, up from 57 per cent in the last fortnight, according to the poll by Ipsos MORI.

item.title: Little House On The Prairie fans claim the show 'PREDICTED' the COVID-19 crisis
item.description: Melissa Gilbert,Â 55, who played childÂ Laura Ingalls on the show fromÂ 1974-83, has also said that the show and current crisis are 'applicable'.

item.title: Children at risk of 'heart attacks if Kawasaki is misdiagnosed as coronavirus'
item.description: NHS officials fear it is a complication of COVID-19 and say it has symptoms similar to Kawasaki, including abdominal pain and rashes. But a British charity fears cases could be misdiagnosed.

item.title: Earliest African slaves in Mexico were beaten, shot and riddled with disease, study finds
item.description: Three skeletons unearthed at a mass grave on the grounds of Hospital Real de San JosÃ© de los Naturales, an early colonial period hospital in Mexico City were studied by scientists.

item.title: Chilling moment boyfriend calls police to confess to slitting his partner's throat in knife attack
item.description: Karl Molyneaux (left inset), 52, of South Shields, South Tyneside, fled his girlfriend's (right inset) house and CCTV shows him calling 999 at a petrol station (main). WARNING GRAPHIC CONTENT.

item.title: Donald Trump tweets claim economy will be so strong Democrats will accuse him of hyping COVID-19
item.description: President Donald Trump retweeted a conservative supporter Thursday who predicted the economy will be doing so well by summer Democrats will accuse him of 'hyping' the coronavirus outbreak.

item.title: Drug dealer is jailed for more than four years after police find Â£30,000 of cocaine
item.description: Perry Rickenberg, 23, (pictured) was a passenger in the taxi when it was stopped by police on the A13, in Rainham, Essex, on Tuesday September 2 last year.

item.title: Man, 49, from Somerset, is terrified of his downstairs loo after finding seven-inch gecko inside it
item.description: Andy Brown, 49, has a phobia of his downstairs loo after finding the reptile in his home in Keynsham, Somerset. He and his wife, Elaine, 48, had to phone a friend to help rescue the gecko from the bowl.

item.title: Low cost airline Wizz Air will resume flights form Luton tomorrow
item.description: Wizz Air's chief executive said he hoped to have 70 per cent of services operational by August. Passengers won't be able to get refunds if they cancel flights, even if they won't be let into a country.

item.title: People share their best fashion looks with the #MetGalaChallenge
item.description: People from all over the US are taking part in the #MetGalaChallenge, which was launched by Billy Porter and Vogue Magazine, encouraging people to recreate their favourite looks from home.

item.title: More than 1,800 jobs are set to be lost at Oasis and Warehouse
item.description: More than 1,800 jobs are set to be lost at Oasis and Warehouse as administrators said they were unable to rescue the company behind the brands. Deloitte has blamed the coronavirus.

item.title: More than 3,000 extra police officers have been hired in six months
item.description: The overall provisional headcount of officers in England and Wales is now 131,596. This is a 5% rise on March last year, of which the recruitment drive accounts for approximately half.

item.title: Millions of Britons could lose the right to a cash refund for cancelled flights due to coronavirus
item.description: Transport ministers from twelve EU member states are attempting to block British consumers' legal rights to a refund for cancelled flights due to the coronavirus pandemic, to protect cash-poor airlines.

item.title: People share their very successful attempts at making wagamama chicken katsu curry
item.description: Fans have been making Katsu Curry at home, after the Pan-Asian chain's executive chef shared some of Wagamamas secret recipes on social media as part of it 'wok from home' series.

item.title: South Korea admits 292 coronavirus 'reinfections' were false positives
item.description: A clinical expert has now said the flurry of 'reinfected' COVID-19 patients in the past month was due to a testing fault. Dead viral fragments may remain in the body.

item.title: Arthritis drug may prevent severely ill coronavirus patients from needing life support
item.description: A small French study has found that severely ill coronavirus patients given tocilizumab, a drug used to treat rheumatoid arthritis, were less likely to be put on life support and less likely to die.

item.title: Sweden's top virologist admits too little was done to protect the elderly
item.description: Admitting his mistakes on Swedish television, Anders Tegnell (pictured) accepted he was wrong to play down the crisis in January but said he did not have a 'crystal ball'.

item.title: Boris Johnson calls Captain Tom a 'point of light in all our lives'
item.description: The Prime Minister has called Colonel Tom Moore a 'point of light in our lives' as he wished him a happy birthday and thanked him for helping to pull the nation together through the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Cruise liners take shelter off the Isle of Wight but without any passengers on board
item.description: The area south of the Isle of Wight s often used by vessels when the weather is particularly severe and is also out of the way of major shipping lanes.

item.title: Justice Secretary criticises Wetherspoons' June reopening plan
item.description: Justice Secretary Robert Buckland, pictured, has criticised a decision by Wetherspoons' boss Tim Martin to plan reopening his 900-pub empire in June as this undermines the battle against the virus.

item.title: WHO warns Europe to brace for second and third coronavirus wave
item.description: Dr Hans Kluge (pictured) said Europe remained 'very much in the grip' of the pandemic despite a 'plateau or reduction in new cases' caused by the lockdown.

item.title: Meghan Markle's mentee reveals she is STILL in shock about 'surprise' of the 'down-to-earth' royal
item.description: Krisi Uzunova, from London, posted online to say she still hadn't gotten over the surprise of the Duchess of Sussex, 38, joining her virtual SmartWorks interview session.

item.title: The ALTERNATIVE Premier League table: Manchester United miss out, Arsenal fall to 12th
item.description: As doubts grow about the viability of playing out the rest of the Premier League season, a number of methods have been mooted to complete the campaign. L'Equipe proposed their own.

item.title: Britain warns EU a post-Brexit trade deal is under threat unless it drops fishing demands
item.description: Officials blamed the EU for 'limited progress' so far in discussions over a free trade agreement, because of demands in areas including the resources in the waters around Britain.

item.title: Harry Dunn's parents' urge Donald Trump to review decision to block extradition of Anne SacoolasÂ
item.description: The letter, addressed to President Trump and Mike Pompeo, comes after it was reported that lawyers acting on behalf of Anne Sacoolas, 42, had opened up a dialogue with the Foreign Office.

item.title: Coronavirus: New study slams Remdesivir 'wonder drug' claims
item.description: Remdesivir was reported by US officials to have 'clear-cut' evidence it works. But a study from China published hours before says otherwise, finding no evidence it helped COVID-19 patients.

item.title: Equalities watchdog warns exam bosses that BAME students will suffer from grading bias
item.description: Ofqual have set out the grading-process this summer by instructing schools and colleges to award students with a grade that reflects what they would've achieved if they sat their exams.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Most businesses still waiting for furlough help
item.description: Office for National Statistics data revealed that 19% of UK firms that applied for the furlough scheme received help since it went live on April 20.

item.title: Astronomers capture mesmerising images of planet-forming discs of dust and gas
item.description: An international team of astronomers used the Europe Southern Observatory Very Large Telescope in Chile to take 15 images of the inner rims of planetary discs.

item.title: Germany bans Hezbollah, raids mosques
item.description: Like the European Union, Germany had until now only outlawed Hezbollah's military wing while tolerating its political wing.
item.media:description: A police officer walks out of Al-Irschad Mosque during a raid in Berlin, as dozens of police and special forces stormed mosques and associations linked to Hezbollah in Bremen, Berlin, Dortmund and Muenster early Thursday.

item.title: Police investigating 'murder' of missing sex worker scour North Yorkshire park's lake
item.description: Albert Park in Middlesbrough has been closed to the publicÂ and an underwater team is checking the park's 30-hectare lake and waterways for any sign of her.

item.title: British Museum makes over half of its collection viewable online during the coronavirus lockdown
item.description: The revamp of the British Museum's online collection includes a zooming facility that allows some objects to be examined at 'a level of detail inaccessible to the naked eye.'

item.title: Meghan Markle's makeup artist reveals the secrets behind her polished Zoom look
item.description: Celebrity makeup artist Ruby Hammer told the Telegraph that the Duchess of Sussex, 38, appeared 'glowy and stress-free' during her video call for patronage SmartWorks.

item.title: World's largest hailstone wider than a football fell in Argentina
item.description: A ferocious storm over Argentina two years ago produced the world's largest hailstone, about the size of a football, scientists report.

item.title: Founder of the Chris Whitty Appreciation Society 'declares love' for Chief Medical Officer
item.description: Founder of the Chris Whitty Appreciation Society Sean Ryan appeared on This Morning where he said that the group was set up to 'declare love' forÂ England's Chief Medical Officer.

item.title: Rolls-Royce says it will be the first UK car maker to resume production from 4 May
item.description: Bosses said that 1,000 employees - half the total workforce - would be backÂ making Phantom, Wraith, Dawn and Cullinan models.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: 'Island communities' could leave lockdown first
item.description: The Cabinet Office Minister told MPs isolated areas where it is easy to control movement in and out could be used as test beds for measures that could then be used on a larger scale.

item.title: Woman can't shut her eyes while sleeping for over a year after botched plastic surgery
item.description: The Chinese woman, Ms Ma, who had a repair surgery after she was unsatisfied with the result of her initial operation in 2018, was shattered when the second procedure went wrong again.

item.title: Jeremy Bamber's lawyers demand CPS hand over withheld papers disclosed to author behind ITV drama
item.description: Lawyers for the 59-year-old, who is serving life in prison for murdering his family in a gun massacre, will head to the high court tomorrow to fight for evidence they believe could help clear his name.

item.title: Melbourne couple are horrified after pet Rottweiler named Millie SWALLOWED their engagement ringÂ
item.description: Amanda Davey from Melbourne, had taken off her expensive ring and placed it on the coffee table to tie her hair up to avoid it getting caught in her scrunchie.

item.title: Mother-of-two reveals how she transformed her tired 1970s Â£467,500 house on a budget
item.description: Laura Deller, a 35-year-old teacher from Birmingham, told FEMAIL she bought the detached five bedroom property in Bedford forÂ Â£467,500 with husband Chris in May last year.

item.title: Coronavirus: Children just as likely to catch infection, study says
item.description: A study by the Shenzhen Center for Disease Control and Prevention found that the virus's attack rate among children was 7.4 per cent, on par with the 6.6 per cent seen in the general population.

item.title: Chinese food street famous for its 'insect feast' REOPENS
item.description: Vendors at the daily night market in Nanning, China, offer all sorts of cooked bugs, from spiders to silkworms, alongside various snacks, main dishes, fresh juices and desserts.

item.title: Student given a private jet to fly to Germany to keep up her experimental cancer treatment
item.description: Laura Nuttall, 30, ofÂ Barrowford, Lancashire, told the BBC she made a 'desperate plea' online when her regular flights to Dusseldorf earlier this month 'disappeared' due to lockdown restrictions.

item.title: Pompeo says 'we haven't seen' Kim Jong-un amid rumours dictator is deadÂ
item.description: Kim Jong-Un was last seen on April 12 inspecting North Korea's Air Force units. His disappearance has triggered speculation that the dictator is critically ill or dead.

item.title: Coronavirus: Over-50s should be in isolation longer, says study
item.description: A Warwick University study found that a 'rolling age-release strategy' was the best option to end the lockdown introduced to slow the spread of the deadly coronavirus.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Police stop family string quartet playing
item.description: Violinist Rafael Todes, 53, his wife Helena Newman, and children Isabella and Max, from Bayswater, London, had been performing Shostakovich's String Quartet No4 when they were stopped.

item.title: Wearing a 24lbs weighed vest all day can help obese people shed excess fat
item.description: Swedish researchers even think the novel weight-loss method could be more effective than some forms of physical exercise.

item.title: Greta Thunberg donates $100,000 to UN children's fund to fight coronavirus
item.description: The 17-year-old Swedish activist (pictured) said the pandemic 'is a child rights crisis, like the climate crisis' as she hailed UNICEF's 'vital work to save children's lives'.

item.title: Son of Count Folke Bernadotte reveals he first heard about his father's assassinationÂ on the radio
item.description: Speaking to BBC World Service's Witness History, Count Bernadotte's youngest son, Bertil Bernadotte, told how he first learned of his father's death while listening to the radio at the age of 12.

item.title: Leader of GMB trade union Tim Roache faces misconduct probe after quitting unexpectedly
item.description: The GMB said it was looking into claims against Tim Roache, who resigned as its general secretary on Tuesday night after it received an anonymous letter last week.

item.title: Trump claims China's response to the coronavirus is proof Beijing wants Joe Biden to win election
item.description: President Donald Trump said on Wednesday about the response of Chinese officials regarding COVID-19: 'They're constantly using public relations to try to make it like they're innocent parties.'

item.title: PAUL THOMAS on... Boris the new dad
item.description: 'I can't take much paternity leave - I'm sure Dominic Raab can step in and change nappies'

item.title: Self harm in prisons rockets by 14 per cent to a record high with 63,328 recorded incidents in 2019
item.description: The report from the Ministry of Justice found the number of prisoners self-harming rose by 3 per cent last year, to the highest recorded figure of 12,977.

item.title: Kate Middleton has a 'wicked sense of humour', reveals duchess' hairdresser
item.description: Richard Ward, who blow dries Kate Middleton's hair at his Chelsea salon and styled her locks for her evening wedding reception, told People the Duke and Duchess are a down-to-earth couple.

item.title: Silk purse owned by 17th-Century admiral who brought Charles II back from exile on sale for Â£200,000
item.description: The purse (left) depicts admiral Sir William Penn (right), who died in London in 1670, standing next to a globe with his dog Port. It is believed to have been made by his daughter Margaret aged 15.

item.title: Parents of four-year-old boy with cancer say he'll die in lockdown if they don't raise Â£250,000
item.description: Dianne Jokene, 31 and her husband Elly, 36, from South London, are battling to save their son's life after being told Mehlyk, four, who has stage four neuroblastoma, has just weeks to live.

item.title: Surgeons warn thousands will die if Britain comes out of lockdown
item.description: Prof Neil Mortensen of the Royal College of Surgeons, pictured, warned that Covid-19 has not been defeated as his one third of his members complain of shortages in PPE.

item.title: NHS staff pay respects as cortege stops outside A&E after worker died from coronavirus
item.description: Jane Murphy, 73, who worked as a clinical support worker at the Royal Infirmary of Edinburgh, died of coronavirus on April 16. Her funeral took place on Thursday morning.

item.title: Prince Charles appears to have some new photo additions in his office
item.description: Prince Charles apears to have moved two new pictures into his office since his last video call at the beginning of April, includingÂ him walking Alexandra Knatchbull down the aisle in 2016.

item.title: Prince Harry 'tells friends he misses the army and cannot believe how his life has panned out'Â
item.description: The Duke of Sussex told friends he 'cannot believe' how his life has been 'turned upside down' in recent months and believes he would have been better protected if he was still in the Army.

item.title: Student spends four months transforming WWII air-raid shelter in his parents' garden into a SAUNA
item.description: Oxford University student Jonathan Warby, 26, bought an Â£800 heater and used cheap wood from a recycling centre to create the spa facility at the home in Henley-on-Thames, Oxfordshire.

item.title: Woman who was sick of falling victim to her boyfriend's tricks covers his entire bedroom in tinfoil
item.description: Madeline Mai- Davies, 18, from Hertforshire, spent three hours using 10 packs of tin foil, worth Â£15, to cover every single item in her boyfriend's room and filmed his reaction for TikTok.

item.title: Documentary following Prince William over the course of a year will air on the BBC
item.description: The one-off programme, currently titled Tackling Mental Health With the Duke of Cambridge, will see the prince examine 'men's mental health through the prism of football'.

item.title: AstraZeneca strikes deal with Oxford University to mass produce experimental COVID-19 vaccine
item.description: Human trials of the ChAdOx1 nCoV-19 vaccine developed by Oxford University's Jenner Institute began last week, with hundreds of people volunteering to be part of the study.

item.title: Ruff ride? Driving with a dog in the car encourages motorists to be more careful, study reveals
item.description: Over two thirds of drivers aged 18 to 24 travel more safely when accompanied by a dog with motorists in London and the south-east the most affected, according to a survey from Spanish car maker Seat.

item.title: Dad makes impressive playhouse for his kids - and it cost just Â£150Â
item.description: Wayne Mulholland, 38, from Coventry, made a playhouse for his children using materials left over from building sites. In total, the impressive project cost just Â£150.

item.title: Princess Anne marks theÂ opening of the NHS Louisa Jordan Hospital in Glasgow
item.description: The Princess Royal, 69, appeared in a clip on the Royal Family's Twitter account to congratulate those involved in the building and preparation of theÂ NHS Louisa Jordan Hospital in Glasgow.

item.title: Reverend Richard Coles announces death of his sister-in-lawÂ Louise after COVID-19 battle
item.description: The former Strictly star, 58, took to Twitter on Wednesday to share the devastating news just four months after losing his partner David.

item.title: Care home nurse dies from suspected coronavirus in arms of daughter,12, as fundraiser raises Â£8,000
item.description: Vicky Prado from Kent died in front of her daughter Alex.A fundraiser to send her daughter to family in the Philippines has raised Â£7,700. Elvy Court care home in Sittingbourne paid tribute.

item.title: Recipe for peanut butter cookies with five ingredients sparks viral craze
item.description: @foodies Tik Tok account, from the US, posted a tutorial video for peanut butter cookies which are created using five simple ingredients - peanut butter, brown sugar, baking soda, egg and chocolate chips

item.title: Woman, 23, has a live six-inch worm removed from her brain due to 'raw wild animal meat'
item.description: Revolting footage shows the white parasite wiggling in a bowl after the surgery in a hospital in Nanjing, China. Doctors suggested such infection was caused by unhygienic food, such as raw wild animal meat.

item.title: Tik Tok star goes viral after visiting his grandmother
item.description: British Lewis Leigh, 18, has racked up over seven million views and a million likes with the video ofÂ Phyllis, 76, performing a dance toÂ Laxed Siren Beat Loop by Jawsh 685.

item.title: Radiohead's Thom Yorke thrills fans as he debuts haunting new song Plasticine Fingers
item.description: Radiohead's Thom Yorke delighted fans on Wednesday as he debuted his haunting new song onÂ The Tonight Show with Jimmy Fallon.

item.title: British man arrested in Thailand on suspicion of murder after prostitute found dead
item.description: Neil Henry Elliott, 46, was arrested in Thailand's sex capital of Pattaya on Thursday morning after allegedly admitting to police that he beat and stabbed a prostitute named 'Onn' to death.

item.title: MoD tests insect repellent to see if it kills the strain of coronavirus that causes COVID-19Â
item.description: The company which manufactures the product in the UK,Â Citrefine International Ltd, based in Leeds, called on the Government to test the product and see if it is effective.

item.title: Woman is blackmailed by fake Russian gynaecologist
item.description: The victim Maria from Russia sought help from her hospital and an online forum but was refused an appointment due to the lockdown and a ban on nonessential consultations.

item.title: Meet the pig influencers with 15,000 Instagram followers
item.description: Amanda Zarabozo, from Wallingford, Connecticut, and her fiancÃ© Charles Leiss share their bed with two pet pigs Lucy and Lily. And when the couple tie the knot, their pigs will have starring roles.

item.title: The Repair Shop woman cries over grandfather's miner's lamp
item.description: The Repair Shop customer Rita explained her grandfather used the lamp to prop up the roof of the Hook Colliery, in Pembrokeshire, giving himself enough room to breathe.

item.title: Man, 44, is charged with murder of singer Eddy Grant's niece, 36
item.description: Denise Keane-Barnett-Simmons, who is Eddy Grant's niece, was pulled from the burning house in Brent, north-west London, by firefighters on Thursday April 16.

item.title: First-time mother with coronavirus is forced to give birth in hospital's bereavement room
item.description: Medics at St Helier Hospital in Sutton had to put Claire Trusson in the most isolated room on the ward to keep her away from all others.

item.title: Britain's first transgender parents say surrogate will remain in daughter's life
item.description: Britain's first transgender parents Hannah, 32, and Jake Graf, 41, appeared on today's GMB from their London home, where they said their unnamed surrogate is 'the most inspiring mother'.

item.title: Celebrity London restaurateur tells of racist Chinese backlash over Covid-19 and slashed tyres
item.description: Geoff Leong, 43, who owns Dumplings' Legend in London's China Town, told how people had been assaulted, children ostracised at school and others spat at while they went about their lives.

item.title: Size 10 mother-of-two reveals how she has been body-shamed TWICE
item.description: A size 10 mother-of-two, from the UK, revealed on Mumsnet that she had been body-shamed in the street by men while jogging. She went on to post a snap of her running attire online.

item.title: How to burn calories while working from home at your desk
item.description: Speaking to FEMAIL, Tom Sheppey, co-founder of UK fitness platform Odhealth, revealed we're gaining seven hours thirty minutes by not commuting, over half of us are spending the spare time sleeping.

item.title: Award-winning contemporary home dubbed the 'Ghost House' goes on sale for Â£2.5million
item.description: The home - dubbed the 'Ghost House' thanks to its glass build and because it's hidden from view as you approach it - is on sale in the village of Moreton Paddox in Stratford-upon-Avon for Â£2.5million.

item.title: Brainteaser challenges nation to find fifty popular things associated with the Nineties
item.description: A new say-what-you-see brainteaser, created by UK company Reflect Digital, challenges the nation to name the 50 cultural references from the Nineties - but how will you fare?

item.title: Woman falls to her death while posing for a photo on Turkish cliff
item.description: Kazakh native Olesya Suspitsyna perished in front of her female friend who was taking the photograph in the tourist city of Antalya in the south-west of the country.

item.title: Sainsbury's predicts loss of more than Â£500m profits this year
item.description: Boss Mike Coupe has revealed that for five days running at the start of the lockdownÂ food sales were higher than the busiest shopping days at Christmas leaving shelves largely empty.

item.title: Bollywood star Rishi Kapoor dies in Mumbai at 67 after two-year battle with leukemia
item.description: His death, confirmed by is brother Randhir, comes just hours after the passing of another Indian star Irrfan Khan at age 54, dealing a double blow to the Bollywood film industry.

item.title: Family home that featured in John Lewis Christmas advert is for sale for Â£2.8m
item.description: The stunning house in Surrey's Kingston-Upon-Thames featured in the retailer's 2014 Christmas advert, which showed an inseparable boy and a penguin playing hide-and-seek together.

item.title: How do we convince our elderly father to sign a straightforward will?
item.description: The only item in the will is his house, which will be split 50/50 between my brother and I anyway. There's nothing underhand going on in any way. Lawyer Jane Sutherland of Nelsons, pictured, replies.

item.title: Bodybuilder claims plants helped to dramatically improve his psoriasis
item.description: Mohammed Khan, 22, from Toronto, Canada, says that using Oregon Grape Root serum, which inhibits enzymes involved in psoriatic skin cell production, helped ease his symptoms in weeks.

item.title: Mother, 29, shares a look inside her VERY organised home and shares budget Kmart products she loves
item.description: An Australian mum has offered a look inside her very well-organised home, and revealed which Kmart products she uses and where. Stephanie Pase, 29, from Sydney, revealed how to organise yours.

item.title: How to make a pavlova in a SLOW COOKER:
item.description: The new trend began after a recipe was shared to the Slow Cooker Recipes and Tips Facebook page and group and received an instant response from foodies eager to try the creative idea.

item.title: Bondville Model Village goes up for sale for Â£230,000
item.description: In Bondville, Â£230,000 will get you three churches, a couple of pubs, a cricket club, windmill, lighthouse and even more. But there's a catch, the model village in Bridlington is a twelfth of the normal size.
